newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria c.bank allows Bulbank to change name.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria c.bank allows Bulbank to change name.

text.p: The Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) said it has allowed the state-owned Bulbank to drop Bulgarian Foreign Trade Bank from its name.
"The BNB allows Bulbank (Bulgarian Foreign Trade Bank) to change its name to Bulbank," the BNB said in a statement.

Shareholders of Bulgaria's largest commercial bank decided on April 17 to drop reference to foreign trade from its name to signal that the period of narrow-field performance was over and now the bank was operating as an universal bank.
BNB permission was needed for the decision to become effective.
Bulbank assets amounted to 1.35 trillion levs or 2.769 billion dollars at end-1996.
Government foreign debts accumulated under the communist regime, which collapsed in 1989, were included in the balance sheet of Bulbank, then known as Bulgarian Foreign Trade Bank (BFTB).
Most of those debts have been written off the bank's balance sheet since then and were taken over as state debt by the Finance ministry. -- Sofia Newsroom, (++359-2) 911 88
